summary.p: Peter Schnyder, the bearer of the letter, will consult with the Prior of Kappel [Peter Simler] regarding the two boys [Abraham and Beat Steinegger] and subsequently speak on the same matter in Zurich. Request for advice on how to proceed with the boys. Thanks.

div.p: Our friendly greetings, along with the expression of all honor, love, and goodness beforehand, to the well-educated, pious, noble, honorable, wise, especially dear lord and good friend.

Since your good will and worthy friendship towards us is not hidden and we have often felt such from you, our particularly dear friend and preacher, Herr Peter Schnyder, the bearer of this letter (after he has dealt with the Prior of Kappel regarding our two boys) will come to you concerning matters which we have given him in earnest command (regarding the said boys), as you will then hear from him. We kindly ask you to advise him and us as the well-educated and understanding ones on how to proceed further with the boys. Nothing more agreeable can you show us, for which we would gladly and kindly be indebted to you with the help of the Almighty, whom we ask to preserve your worthy wisdom happily, etc.
Given on April 29th, in the year 1541.
The Mayor and Council of Biel.
To the well-educated, pious, noble, and wise Master Heinrich Bullinger along with other preachers of the city of Zurich, our dear and good friends.
